Technological Choices for Assignment 3

NOTE: this is a writeup for our plans for Assignment 3, there is no implementation yet.

In this assignment, I am tasked with creating serverless functions using JavaScript to manage backend logic, API interactions, and database operations. These functions will leverage asynchronous programming to handle tasks such as fetching data, processing user in put, and executing background tasks, ensuring a smooth and seamless user experience.For my implementation, I am focusing on adding a POST feature to the blog page of my website. This feature will allow users to create blog posts directly on the site without needing access to the Strapi admin panel. The MANAGE BLOG POST button will be prominently displayed at the top left corner of the blog page to provide easy access. When clicked, the button will direct users to a dedicated form, opening in a new page, where they can create and submit their blog posts. The form will communicate with Strapiâ€™s API via serverless functions hosted on Netlify, ensuring secure and efficient submission of data. Input validation will be implemented on both the client and server sides to maintain data integrity.

To secure the system and manage user privileges, I will implement user authentication. A registration form will allow new users to create accounts, while returning users will be able to log in to access the blog page. If an unauthenticated user attempts to access the blog page, they will be redirected to either the login or registration page, depending on their status. Serverless functions will handle the backend logic for registration and login processes, including secure storage and verification of user credentials through tools like bcrypt for hashing and jsonwebtoken for session management. Authenticated users will then have access to create and manage blog posts tied to their accounts. For deployment, I will host the serverless functions on Netlify to utilize its robust support for serverless computing. Meanwhile, the website itself will be hosted on Vercel. This approach allows me to take advantage of Netlify's powerful serverless platform while displaying the website on Vercel. The site will also be linked to my portfolio page, which is also hosted on Vercel.

The project will be built using a combination of tools and technologies, including JavaScript , HTML, and CSS (Bootstrap) for the front-end. Strapi will serve as the headless CMS to manage blog content, and Netlify Functions will handle backend logic such as user authentication and blog post submission. An authentication library like jsonwebtoken or OAuth will be used to secure user sessions and access. Throughout this project, I will address challenges such as securing authentication workflows, managing API rate limits in the serverless environment, and ensuring a user-friendly interface. Error-handling mechanisms will also be integrated to gracefully manage invalid inputs or API failures. By balancing these elements, the system will deliver a reliable and efficient experience for users. Looking ahead, I plan to extend the project by adding features such as editing and deleting blog posts, integrating a rich text editor for enhanced content creation, and implementing a commenting system to encourage user engagement. These additions will further enhance the functionality of the site and demonstrate my ability to develop robust, user-centric web applications.
